SENT.plain: A 28 year old woman with angiographically proven thrombosis of right cerebral transverse sinus was studied from a clotting point of view
The changes noted were decreased fibrinolytic activity and increased collagen platelet aggregation
The patient presented loss of consciousness, aphasia, mental confusion, migh right hemiparesis, papilloedema
The treatment with dipyridamole, aspirin and a nicotinic acid derivative was followed by good results
After about a month the fundus reverted to normal
A clotting study is indicative in every patient with cerebral venous thrombosis
